Message.Title: YTD Earnings Plunge 37%. And the sheep cheer?
Message.Msg: - YTD Earnings Plunge 37%. And the sheep cheer? Just as Best predicted – Yet another Bad quarter. GAAP Net Income Plunged Precipitously for the six months, as follows. $286,782,000 __ Last year, 6 months ending 7/31/2011 $179,483,000 __ This year, 6 months ending 7/29/2012 ---------------- (-$107,299,000) < Earnings no longer there, right boys? (-37.4%) < YTD Plunge in Net Income On a GAAP Earnings per Share basis, it looks even worse. Due to the dilution effect of all the free employee shares handed out like Halloween candy. $0.47 __ Last year, 6 months ending 7/31/2011 $0.29 __ This year, 6 months ending 7/29/2012 ------- (-$0.18) < EPS no longer there, right boys? (-38.3%) < YTD Plunge in Earnings per Share Now, Jen and his Interim CFO know full well that the bought-and-paid-for shareholders don’t like to see the Dilution in their EPS caused by all those free employee shares. So they try to hide it with talk of “proforma” this and that. Does the above Awful performance look like anything to cheer about? Hummm? Well does it? (-$107,299,000) of last year’s YTD Earnings – Gone. (-$0.18) of fully diluted EPS no longer there. The only cheering that should take place for a purported "growth company" is when nvidia does Better than last year -- not Worse. Now say it ain’t so. -

Topic.Title: shift to mobile

Message.Msg: - "The competition in the smartphone and tablet industry is fierce and crowded. Numerous companies battle for every hundredth of market share, as each percent of the market is worth millions. Microsoft, Apple, Samsung and other players in these fields must develop, produce, test, and redesign, if necessary, their products. These competitors must play their cards perfectly to gain a sizable share of the market. All Qualcomm (NASDAQ: QCOM) must do is innovate its chips to integrate into any company’s devices. Qualcomm’s chipsets are found in nearly all brands of mobile phones, tablets, smart grids, 3G and 4G networking equipment, and other devices. Qualcomm is compatible in nearly all brands of mobile devices, allowing it to sell virtually across the entire market. This is a tremendous trait -- if the company can is able to integrate its technology into even a select percentage of the market, the market is rapidly growing, as shown below. Strong Fundamentals In 2009, Qualcomm reported earnings per share of $0.95. In 2014, the average analyst consensus believes earnings per share will reach $3.64. That represents an increase of 283.16% in earnings per share over just 5 years. Based on these statistics, its compound annual growth rate (CAGR) is 30.82%, an incredible feat for a largely established company. Qualcomm’s earnings per share Grow Every Single Year, presenting consistency in this division of a company. Its sprawling growth rate will allow the company to reinvest in research and development, to develop innovative chips pursued by device makers. In addition, the company pays out an annual dividend of $1.00, which at current prices yields 1.63%. Its dividend is not tremendously significant, but outpaces the 10-year treasury rate at 1.60%, and nearly offsets inflation at 1.70%. All in all, Qualcomm possesses a rock-solid growth profile, as well as decent dividend. The chart below displays Qualcomm’s sales, operating profit, net income, net margin, operating margin, earnings per share, dividend, and rate of dividend (the percentage of net income that is paid out in the dividend) over the coming years. In terms of growth, Qualcomm stands in the middle of the road, while Broadcom tops the charts. Ericsson pays out the largest dividend, with Intel possessing the fastest-growing dividend. In the fundamental ratio comparison, Intel trades at the lowest multiple, with Broadcom trading at a premium. Because of Qualcomm’s innovative profile, it's able to integrate its chips into nearly the entire marketplace. As the marketplace expands, with the rapid shift to mobile devices, Qualcomm will be in perfect position to take advantage of this huge opportunity." Sorry boys. nvidia didn't even get a mention. When talking about mobile chip makers. -

Message.Title: NVDA=Nvidia Verily Delivers A's
Message.Msg: It was indeed a barnburner of a CC following the positive earnings PR. Congrats to all longs esp. those WHO HELD ON during the last hour price surge yesterday and thus overcame the serious temptation to offload for short profits. Euphoria aside, let’s model for this 3rd quarter the trading range and the plausible high price target of the stock. Barring a global economic collapse in the next 3 months, I humbly submit in this post earnings phase, the stock which now bears an adjusted forward metric multiple of about 16, should trade mainly within the ambit of 15.5 and 17, only fleetingly touching the high mark of near 17.5 in the last month prior to 3rd Q earnings release; the 3rd Q recorded high would not be reminiscent of yesterday’s trading action predominating in the final closing bell--no last-hour pre-earnings price peak redux for 3rd Q final hour trading. Humor me if you do not consider the above figures Pollyannaish. Best to all.

Message.Title: S&P REITERATES BUY OPINION ON SHARES OF NVIDIA CORP.
Message.Msg: (Some good news for longs - maybe QCOM should buy NVDA?) S&P REITERATES BUY OPINION ON SHARES OF NVIDIA CORP. (S&P Capital IQ) We are raising our FY 13 (Jan.) and FY 14 operating EPS estimates each by $0.23 to $0.87 and $1.06, respectively. We are raising our target price by $1 to $17 based on our higher EPS estimates and a slightly lower multiple of 16X, due to lower industry multiples. NVDA raised its Oct-Q outlook, while maintaining solid operating expense discipline. We expect strong product ramps for Tegra and Kepler to continue their momentum. NVIDA reported Jul-Q operating EPS of $0.22, vs.$0.30, $0.07 above our estimate on higher revenue of $1.04B.

Message.Msg: Are you nuts? Qualcomm warned, Intel warned, almost every tech stock warned.. but nvda? Nooooo... it's the same trick Jen uses every time. Message.Title: Longs have nothing to lose sleep on
Message.Msg: Take a deep breath, the worst is indeed over for the day. It's hard to relax when something fishy appears to be afoot, when weird trading pattern of this stock seems to run counter to positive earnings news. Several factors may explain it: 1)Program/algorithm trading is likely the culprit. At the start of the trading day, automated selling was in order in response to the downbeat news from overseas, namely China which then affected bourses in Europe. But the European markets did pare their losses at closing. 2) Because of large positions bought up by non-retail investors late yesterday, stops were taken out which then exacerbated further selloff. Look at the number of shares traded yesterday; it was twice the usual number of 8 to10 mil. And today midday, it did already exceed twice that usual number; it’s over 24 mil at about 1.30 as I write. All the ‘protective stops’ that are associated with the previous day purchases, from yesterday’s late-in-day 14.45 upward price surge, all these stops put in place were activated. The worst is really over. I might even hazard to say that we may likely close in the green or close to it. NVDA’s fundamentals are solid going forward. It will soon draw back those flighty speculators because they do realize they are tracking a winner. Have confidence in this stock if you have done your homework and are a longer-term NVDA shareholder. Good luck all.

Topic.Title: Who bought after hour yesterday?

Message.Msg: don't try and dissect logical explanation out of 90% of this earnings season. This is down because hedgies drifted out after run up and wanted it down. JCP is up despite terrible eps, guidance, and forecast, because hedgies pumped to drift out. Same with GMCR. PWER came down hard after record earnings. Most companies have missed top line revs and lowered guidance; still rallied. AMCX got hit after great earnings. AMZN horrible - big down, then up. There's no rhyme or reason. A low vol market is extremely easy to manipulate by big money and they have been playing it all earnings season to make up for their abysmal YTD performance when compared to global equities. Ergo, it's a crap shoot and NVDA got the wrong end of stick. There's nothing else to be said really.

Topic.Title: Longs have nothing to lose sleep on

Message.Msg: It's going to be bouncing between $13.5 - $16 short term. One or two HOLD analysts appears to be gaining the upper hand based on : 1) Longevity of discrete graphics business 2) Advance computing solutions growth is nothing to write home about 3) Mobile business is too early to replace potential revenue loss from discrete graphics if attachment rates goes down rapidly 4) Not able to go toe to toe with QC in the CP market at this time Basically these few guys are very negative and planting seeds of doubt for the smart money guys. The Graphics business would have to increase by >50% for it to make the issue go away temporarily. A better offensive would be for Nvidia to start sampling integrated LTE solutions and the next generation T4 (whilst blowing away the competition on performance) soon - when this happen, there'll be nothing to hold NVDA back. T4 I am sure is ready and perhaps Integrated 28nm T3'+LTE as well - what's holding them up is capacity - you don't want to trade 65% margin Graphics business for 50% mobile business - if you can help it.

Topic.Title: Longs have nothing to lose sleep on

Message.Msg: the one thing Jen did say previously (although not in the CC yesterday at all) was that they made a mistake in previewing the Tegra 3 chip before launch time. It cannibilized Tegra 2 sales as builders waited on the T3 and T2 chips stacked in inventory and had to sell at a discount to clear. That being said we probably won't hear much about the Tegra 4 chip until it's already coming out, simular to the T33 1.7 Tegra 3 that is starting to ship right now.

Message.Title: I am secretly happy that the opportunistic traders getting are getting burned
Message.Msg: and may never come back. These folks are like locusts - they are bad news for any stock. The longs have nothing to worry about. If you check the historical prices, a major low was reached on option expiry week in August of 2011, and stock recovered from then on till yearend, gaining 40%. The tech stocks are known to be seasonal in this matter.

Topic.Title: Longs have nothing to lose sleep on

Message.Msg: Your comments is right on - there were very early posts ~ Jan time frame that said they were sampling T4 to selective customers - I think they shut the sampling down pretty quickly when they found out what happened to T2 inventory coupled with the severe 28nm supply issue. The good news is 28nm supply issue would be a none issue by Q4 - if confirmed I would not be surprised we'll hear major shipment ready announcements from NVDA - they have to, whether they like it or not to hold on to the next wave of models with Sammy and Qcom revealing their new offerings and possibly going into production by Q4.

Topic.Title: wtf Happpened Today...

Message.Msg: Me too. EVERY SINGLE stock that has blown away earnings estimates this season has soared afterhours AND the next day. Intel, which only met expectations and gave weaker than expected guidance, but not as bad as expected, went up 4% the next day. WHAT A FRICKIN JOKE TODAY WAS FOR NVDA!!!! Numerous buy recs and upgraded price targets. Cripes, even the two analysts who maintained a HOLD rating on the stock upped their price targets. This was EASILY the best example of a rigged market I've seen this earning season, BY FAR!! And, I refused to sell my shares to scumbag hedge funds, MM's, or whomever the h-ll was responsible for this travesty. I expect this kind of crap with stocks like SODA, that have a 60% short interest. It had an awesome quarter and great guidance, yet ended 2% down the day after announcing. That was major crap, too (and, that's why I wouldn't buy it going into earnings). But, NVDA had only a 2.5% short interest. So, I have no clue as to why this did what it did. I had a great week up until today. Let's hope firms who loaded today in the $14.50's and 14.60's come out with buys on Monday, like they should. This stock is ridiculously cheap. Jeez, look at the volume. Somebody was accumulating a LOT of dirt cheap shares today. Hopefully, sanity returns to this stock on Monday. GLTA.

Topic.Title: TSMC hit record revenues in July

Topic.Title: TSMC hit record revenues in July

Message.Msg: - So Best? Did we catch ibbey editing out the Truth again? It sure looks like it. 'Cause Morris Chang, the Chairman and CEO of leading foundry chipmaker Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. Ltd., just warned that a Slowdown is coming to the chip market. And Brutally Slashed his forecast for the total semiconductor market's annual growth. Here's the market moving news that ibbey probably didn't want the folks at home to be reading about TSMC. http://eetimes.com/electronics-news/4390786/Morris-Chang-cuts-forecast "Grim times ahead, boys" says TSMC's Chairman Chang, -- the company that actually makes all of nvidia's chips for them, because nvidia owns no fab plant. "Grim grim times." -

Topic.Title: TSMC hit record revenues in July

Message.Msg: - TSMC's Chang cuts forecast, sees stall coming Peter Clarke 7/20/2012 6:08 AM EDT LONDON – Morris Chang, chairman and CEO of leading foundry chipmaker Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. Ltd., has Warned that a Slowdown is Coming to the chip market and has cut his forecast for the total semiconductor market's annual growth, according to reports. Chang, speaking during TSMC's second quarter earnings conference on Thursday (July 19), disclosed a cut in the growth forecast for the global semiconductor market in 2012 to between 1 and 2 percent, the reports said. This is lower than recent forecasts from Future Horizons Ltd. (4 percent) and from International Data Corp. (4.6 percent). Chang said the slowdown is set to start in the fourth quarter and last into the first quarter of 2013, and put it down to a renewed Inventory Correction and Deterioration in the Global Economy, the reports said." Probably not the best time to be owning Any semiconductor stocks, right boys? But hey, if you know a Slowdown is coming, just short one of the weaker players, -- like nvidia -- and sit back and enjoy the eminent Plunge in semi stocks. -
